question: Question_01_(g)
sols:
We proceed by integration by parts. Let $\displaystyle u = 5x$ and
$\displaystyle dv = \sin(x+1)\,dx$ so that $\displaystyle du = 5$ and
$\displaystyle v = -\cos(x+1)$. Then

\begin{align*}
\int 5x \sin(x+1)\,dx &= 5x(-\cos(x+1)) - \int 5(-\cos(x+1))\,dx\\
&= -5x\cos(x+1) +5 \int \cos(x+1)\,dx\\
&= -5x\cos(x+1) +5\sin(x+1) + C\end{align*}
hints: What integration technique works well for products?
